titleStmt.title: The first parte of Pasquils apologie Wherin he renders a reason to his friendes of his long silence: and gallops the fielde with the Treatise of reformation lately written by a fugitiue, Iohn Penrie.
titleStmt.author: Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by John Charlewood] where I was, and where I will bee readie by the helpe of God and my muse, to send you the May-game of Martinisme for an intermedium, betweene the first and seconde part of the apologie,

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Penry, John. A treatise wherein is manifestlie proved, that reformation and those that sincerely favor the same, are unjustly charged to be enemies, unto hir Majestie, and the state.
The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A.j."; the last leaf is blank.
